text: Chang Hsing-hsien (; 2 October 1909 – 14 March 1989) was the first Taiwanese athlete participated in the Olympic Games. He was born in Taichung County, Taiwan. He competed under the Japanese name Seiken Cho, as Taiwan was part of the Japanese Empire at the time. He represented Japan at the 1932 and 1936 Summer Olympics. ==References== Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1932 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1936 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Japan Category:Sportspeople from Taichung Category:Taiwanese people of Hoklo descent Category:1909 births Category:1989 deaths
title: Chang Hsing-hsien
